javadoc:
Generic tool interface for managing {@link ComponentProvider}s and 
 {@link DockingActionIf actions}

methods.name: getName
methods.comment:
Returns a combination of the tool name and the instance name of the form
 tool name(instance name), e.g., SomeTool(2)

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if tool is visible
@return true if tool is visible
methods.name: isVisible
methods.comment: Returns true if tool is visible

methods.javadoc:
Sets the tool visible or invisible.  This method is used by
 the Project to make it's tools visible or invisible depending on whether
 this tool is in is the active workspace.
@param visibility true specifies that the tool should be visible
methods.name: setVisible
methods.comment:
Sets the tool visible or invisible.  This method is used by
 the Project to make it's tools visible or invisible depending on whether
 this tool is in is the active workspace.

params.name: visibility
params.comment: true specifies that the tool should be visible

methods.javadoc:
Brings this tool to the front. Places this tool at the top of the
 stacking order and shows it in front of any other tools.
methods.name: toFront
methods.comment:
Brings this tool to the front. Places this tool at the top of the
 stacking order and shows it in front of any other tools.

methods.javadoc:
Get the icon that the tool is using
@return the icon that the tool is using
methods.name: getIcon
methods.comment: Get the icon that the tool is using

return.comment: the icon that the tool is using

methods.name: addComponentProvider
methods.comment: Adds the ComponentProvider to the tool, optionally making it visible.

params.name: componentProvider
params.comment: the provider to add to the tool

params.name: show
params.comment: if true, the component is made visible.

methods.name: removeComponentProvider
methods.comment:
Removes the given ComponentProvider from the tool.  When a provider has been removed 
 from the tool it is considered disposed and should not be reused.

params.name: componentProvider
params.comment: the provider to remove from the tool

methods.name: getComponentProvider
methods.comment: Gets the ComponentProvider with the given name.

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the provider to get

methods.javadoc:
Set the status information
@param text non-html string to be displayed in the Status display area
methods.name: setStatusInfo
methods.comment: Set the status information

params.name: text
params.comment: non-html string to be displayed in the Status display area

methods.name: setStatusInfo
methods.comment: Set the status information

params.name: text
params.comment: string to be displayed in the Status display area

params.name: beep
params.comment: whether to be or not

methods.javadoc: Clear the status information
methods.name: clearStatusInfo
methods.comment: Clear the status information

methods.name: setMenuGroup
methods.comment:
Set the menu group associated with a cascaded submenu.  This allows
 a cascading menu item to be grouped with a specific set of actions.
 
 The default group for a cascaded submenu is the name of the submenu.

params.name: menuPath
params.comment: menu name path where the last element corresponds to the specified group name.

params.name: group
params.comment: group name

params.name: menuSubGroup
params.comment:
the name used to sort the cascaded menu within other menu items at
                     its level

methods.javadoc:
Adds the action to the tool.
@param action the action to be added.
methods.name: addAction
methods.comment: Adds the action to the tool.

params.name: action
params.comment: the action to be added.

methods.name: removeAction
methods.comment:
Removes the given action from the tool.  When an action is removed from the tool it will
 be disposed and should not be reused.

params.name: action
params.comment: the action to be removed.

methods.name: addLocalAction
methods.comment: Adds the action to the given provider as a local action.

params.name: componentProvider
params.comment: the provider to add the action to.

params.name: action
params.comment: the DockingAction to add to the componentProvider.

methods.name: removeLocalAction
methods.comment: Removes the action from the provider

params.name: componentProvider
params.comment: the component provider from which to remove the action.

params.name: action
params.comment: the action to remove.

methods.name: addPopupActionProvider
methods.comment:
Adds the given popup action provider to this tool.   This provider will be called each
 time the popup menu is about to be shown.

params.name: provider
params.comment: the provider

methods.javadoc:
Removes the given popup action provider
@param provider the provider
methods.name: removePopupActionProvider
methods.comment: Removes the given popup action provider

params.name: provider
params.comment: the provider

methods.javadoc:
Return a set of all actions in the tool.

Note: the result may contain conceptually duplicate actions, which is when multiple actions exist that share the same full name (the full name is the action name with the owner name, such as "My Action (MyPlugin)". @return set of all actions
methods.name: getAllActions
methods.comment:
Return a set of all actions in the tool.
 
 Note: the result may contain conceptually duplicate actions, which is when multiple
 actions exist that share the same full name (the full name is the action name with the 
 owner name, such as "My Action (MyPlugin)".

methods.name: getDockingActionsByOwnerName
methods.comment:
Returns all actions for the given owner
 
 Note: the result may contain conceptually duplicate actions, which is when multiple
 actions exist that share the same full name (the full name is the action name with the 
 owner name, such as "My Action (MyPlugin)".

params.name: owner
params.comment: the action owner's name

methods.javadoc:
Returns the active component provider, that which has focus
@return the active provider
methods.name: getActiveComponentProvider
methods.comment: Returns the active component provider, that which has focus

methods.name: showComponentProvider
methods.comment: Shows or hides the component provider in the tool

params.name: componentProvider
params.comment: the provider to either show or hide.

params.name: visible
params.comment: true to show the provider, false to hide it.

methods.name: showDialog
methods.comment:
Shows the dialog using the tool's root frame as a parent.  Also, remembers any size and location
 adjustments made by the user for the next time the dialog is shown.

params.name: dialogComponent
params.comment: the DialogComponentProvider object to be shown in a dialog.

methods.name: getProviderWindow
methods.comment: Returns the parent window for the given provider

params.name: componentProvider
params.comment: the provider

methods.javadoc:
Makes the given ComponentProvider move to the front if it is tabbed with other components.
@param componentProvider the provider to move to the top of its stacking order.
methods.name: toFront
methods.comment: Makes the given ComponentProvider move to the front if it is tabbed with other components.

params.name: componentProvider
params.comment: the provider to move to the top of its stacking order.

methods.name: isVisible
methods.comment: Returns true if the given ComponentProvider is currently visible.

params.name: componentProvider
params.comment: the provider to check for visibility.

return.comment: true if the given ComponentProvider is currently visible.

methods.name: isActive
methods.comment:
Returns true if the ComponentProvider is the currently active provider. The active provider
 is the provider that has keyboard focus and provides the current action context.

params.name: componentProvider
params.comment: the provider to check for active.

return.comment: true if the ComponentProvider is the currently active provider.

methods.javadoc:
Indicates to the tool that the given componentProvider's title has changed.
@param componentProvider the componentProvider whose title has changed.
methods.name: updateTitle
methods.comment: Indicates to the tool that the given componentProvider's title has changed.

params.name: componentProvider
params.comment: the componentProvider whose title has changed.

methods.javadoc:
Signals to the tool that the provider's context has changed. This lets toolbar and menu actions update enablement based on current context.

Pass null to signal that the entire tool's context has changed @param provider the provider whose context changed; null to signal the tool's context
methods.name: contextChanged
methods.comment:
Signals to the tool that the provider's context has changed.  This lets toolbar and 
 menu actions update enablement based on current context.  
 
 Pass null to signal that the entire tool's context has changed

params.name: provider
params.comment: the provider whose context changed; null to signal the tool's context

methods.javadoc:
Returns this tool's notion of the current action context, which is based upon the active
 {@link ComponentProvider}.  If there is not active provider, then a generic context will
 be returned.
@return the context
methods.name: getGlobalContext
methods.comment:
Returns this tool's notion of the current action context, which is based upon the active
 ComponentProvider.  If there is not active provider, then a generic context will
 be returned.

methods.javadoc:
Adds the given context listener to this tool
@param listener the listener to add
methods.name: addContextListener
methods.comment: Adds the given context listener to this tool

params.name: listener
params.comment: the listener to add

methods.javadoc:
Removes the given context listener to this tool
@param listener the listener to add
methods.name: removeContextListener
methods.comment: Removes the given context listener to this tool

params.name: listener
params.comment: the listener to add

methods.javadoc:
Returns the DockingWindowManger for this tool.
@return the DockingWindowManger for this tool.
methods.name: getWindowManager
methods.comment: Returns the DockingWindowManger for this tool.

methods.name: getOptions
methods.comment:
Get the options for the given category name; if no options exist with
 the given name, then one is created.

params.name: categoryName
params.comment: the category name

methods.javadoc:
Toggles the "change" state of the tool...
@param changed true indicates that the tool config has changed.
methods.name: setConfigChanged
methods.comment: Toggles the "change" state of the tool...

params.name: changed
params.comment: true indicates that the tool config has changed.

methods.javadoc:
Return true if the tool's configuration has changed
@return true if the tool's configuration has changed
methods.name: hasConfigChanged
methods.comment: Return true if the tool's configuration has changed

return.comment: true if the tool's configuration has changed

methods.javadoc:
Returns the class that manages actions for the tool.

Most clients will not need to use this methods. Instead, actions should be added to the tool via {@link #addAction(DockingActionIf)} and {@link #addLocalAction(ComponentProvider, DockingActionIf)}. @return the action manager
methods.name: getToolActions
methods.comment:
Returns the class that manages actions for the tool.
 
 Most clients will not need to use this methods.  Instead, actions should be added to
 the tool via #addAction(DockingActionIf) and 
 #addLocalAction(ComponentProvider, DockingActionIf).

methods.javadoc:
Suggests the tool to attempt to close().  This will be as though the user
 selected the close menu option on the tool or hit the closeWindow x button in
 the upper corner (Windows systems).
methods.name: close
methods.comment:
Suggests the tool to attempt to close().  This will be as though the user
 selected the close menu option on the tool or hit the closeWindow x button in
 the upper corner (Windows systems).

name: DockingTool
comment:
Generic tool interface for managing ComponentProviders and 
 DockingActionIf
